page.title: 14HURLANDS FARM, SELHAM
page.content: Hurlands farmhouse in Selham dates from 1529. Mr.Cheal showed us round the buildings of this {350 acre mixed {farm.} There are 40 acres of{woodland, fields for arable{crops}and {pastures for{130 dairy}&{beef cattle. Pheasants are reared for the shooting season and {trout }swim in the Rother. When we arrived the{Fresian cows}had just come in for milking in the parlour. We walked through the yard to see the rearing sheds and the winter barn for calving cows and older stock.{Four men {work this farm; } when they are not in the fields you might find them mending implements in the workshop, collecting silage from the pit or feeding hay to the cattle. {Anna and Toni Cheal }and twins {Clint & Jay Cobbold}live in the cottages and come to{Easebourne}in the school bus.
